Key Arguments: The bill is a significant overreach by the government and a direct attack on freedom of speech.
The bill is inconsistent with international human rights instruments, such as the UN Declaration of Human Rights.
The government and professional media are exempt from the bill, which is hypocritical and undermines free speech.
The bill gives too much power to the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA), which is unelected and lacks transparency and accountability.
The provisions for freedom of speech are tokenistic and do not meet international law standards.
The penalties for breaches are severe and will create a chilling effect on free speech.
The bill allows the government to control truth, which is dangerous for a free and democratic society.
Notable Quotes: This can only be described as state-imposed sanitation of online information.
The reserve powers given to Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) are too much!
This Bill allows the government to 'control truth' and is so dangerous for a free and democratic society.
